name: Sangeeta Yasmeen
themes: Academic Difficulty, Faculty Support, Peer Relationships, Belonging, Cultural Representation, Mental Health, Family Pressure, Work-Life Balance, Personal Growth, Career Preparation
identities: International Student, Student of Color, First-Generation Student
description: Sangeeta Yasmeen, an international student and first-generation student from Bangladesh, discusses the academic challenges, family pressure, work-life balance, and personal growth experienced during her Ph.D. journey in electrical and computer engineering at Oregon State University. She shares how her supportive faculty, peers, and community helped her overcome these obstacles and empowered her to become a teacher and pursue her research in bio sensing to address healthcare disparities in developing countries.
